sentences.sContent: He lowered his legs until he felt he had a solid foothold on the rockface beneath him.
sentences.sCn: 他往下探腿，直到感觉双脚稳稳地踩住了岩石。

sentences.sContent: ...which exploited its sponsorship to win a permanent foothold in the marketplace...
...which exploited its sponsorship to win a permanent foothold in the marketplace...

words.tran: 基础；立足处；社会关系；合计
步行；在…上行走；总计（foot的ing形式）

trans.tranCn: 立足处（攀登时脚踩的地方）
trans.tranOther: a small hole or crack where you can safely put your foot when climbing a steep rock
